page.title: 09Helm Wind
page.content: This wind only began to blow a few hundred years ago. The position of the Eden Valley with the unbroken line of the Pennine Range has formed a number of small and large vacuums. The warmer air in the Valley is at a lower pressure and this sucks the air from the fell top which is at a higher pressure. As the air comes down it begins to whirl and roar and thus we have the Helm wind.The force of the helm wind has decreased in the last 10 years. This is possibly because as mechanistion of the valley increases, more exhaust gases are expelled into the atmosphere and more coal and oil is burned therefore more heat is spreading to the hills; this is now filling the vacuum that the forces of nature used to fill up. Long ago people believed the Fell was inhabited by fiends when the Helm wind blew.
